analyzed: dvayam grāhyam dvayam varjyam yatas vai sukha duḥkha dam
translated: Two should be accepted and two rejected, as they bring happiness and sorrow.

analyzed: dvi śālam putrakasya eva śṛṇuṣva varavarṇini
translated: The two-chambered one is for the son-disciple alone, listen, O fair-complexioned one.

analyzed: vṛṣa siṃha yutam dhāma siddhārtham tat prakīrtitam
translated: The abode endowed with bull and lion is declared to be for the sake of accomplishment.

analyzed: mukha mokṣa karam nityam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: It always brings liberation of the face, there is no doubt for the son-disciple.

analyzed: gaja anaḍvān samāyuktam yama sūryam viduḥ vudhāḥ
translated: The wise know the combination of elephant and donkey to be Yama and Surya.

analyzed: yatas devi varjitavyam prayatnataḥ
translated: O Goddess, since it brings death, it should be carefully avoided.

analyzed: gaja dhvaja samāyuktam daṇḍa ākhyam tat vijānataḥ
translated: One should know the combination of elephant and flag to be called Danda.

analyzed: rāja daṇḍa karat nityam na prāptam tat viśeṣataḥ
translated: It always brings the rod of royal punishment, especially if it is not obtained.

analyzed: dhvaja siṃha samāyuktam vāta ākhyam tat gṛham bhavet
translated: The combination of flag and lion will be the house called Vata.

original: kalahañca bhavennityaṃ na śastaṃ varjayet sadā //
analyzed: kalahaḥ ca bhavet nityam na śastam varjayet sadā
translated: There will always be quarrels, so it should always be avoided.

analyzed: vṛṣadhvaja samāyuktam pakṣi nāmnā ca viśrutaḥ
translated: Associated with Vrishadhvaja (Shiva), it is known by the name of Pakshina (bird).

analyzed: vitta nāśam valat nityam varjitavyam prayatnataḥ
translated: It always brings loss of wealth, so it should be carefully avoided.

analyzed: gaja siṃha samāyuktam kākākī nāmnā ca tat gṛham
translated: Associated with Gajasimha (elephant and lion), that house is known by the name of Kakaki.

original: janaiḥ saha virodha tu tyaktavyaṃ tannasaṃśayaḥ //
analyzed: janaiḥ saha tu tyaktavyam tat na saṃśayaḥ
translated: There will be enmity with people, so it should definitely be abandoned.

analyzed: samayinā eka śālam tu tat śṛṇuṣva varānane
translated: O beautiful lady, listen to the house known as Samayin Ekasala.

analyzed: dhvajam vā siṃha vā ca uttarānanam  Ro
translated: The flag should face west, the lion should face north,

original: vṛṣaṃ vā prāṅmukhaṃ bhadre dakṣiṇāsya gajaṃ na hi /
analyzed: vṛṣam vā prāc mukham bhadre dakṣiṇā asya gajam na hi
translated: O fortunate one, the bull should face east, the elephant should not face south.

original: gṛhamānāṣṭamāsena vistarasya tu vīthikā //🔽vṛṣagṛhāgrato vīthī uṣṇīṣaṃ nāmaviśrutaṃ /
analyzed: gṛha māna aṣṭa māsena vistarasya tu vīthikā  vṛṣa gṛha agratas vīthī uṣṇīṣam nāma viśrutam
translated: The width of the house should be eight months.🔽The street in front of the bull house is known as Ushnisa.

original: siṃhe tu pakṣayorvīthi sāvaṣṭambha tu tadgṛhaṃ //
analyzed: siṃhe tu pakṣayoḥ vīthi sa avaṣṭambha tu tat gṛham
translated: In the lion house, the street is on the sides, that house is Savasthambha (having firm pillars).

original: dhvaja gṛhe samantāntu susthitaṃ taṃ na saṃśayaḥ /🔽gaje paścād bhaved vīthī sāyāśrayavivarjayet //
analyzed: dhvaja gṛhe susthitam tam na saṃśayaḥ  gaje paścāt bhavet vīthī
translated: In the flag house, it is well-established on all sides, there is no doubt.🔽In the elephant house, the street is at the back, it should be avoided as it is inauspicious.

analyzed: vīthīnām kalpanā bhadre sāmānyam cumbaka āditaḥ
translated: O fortunate one, the conception of streets is general from Chumbaka onwards.

analyzed: dvija ādi prakramāt vā asaṃnigadāmi prati prati
translated: I shall now describe the measurements of the houses of Brahmins etc.

original: dvātriṃśadvastu mānena vistaraṃ yadijādairghyantaddaśamāṃsena pūrvaṃ vai
analyzed: dvātriṃśat vastu mānena vistaram yat ijā dairghyam tat daśa māṃsena pūrvam vai
translated: If the length of the house is thirty-two hastas, the breadth should be ten hastas less.

original: yat prakīrtitaṃ //🔽aṣṭāviṃśat kareṇaiva vistaraṃ dakṣiṇaṃ gṛhaṃ /
analyzed: yat prakīrtitam  aṣṭāviṃśat kareṇa eva vistaram dakṣiṇam gṛham
translated: This has been declared first.🔽The southern house should have a breadth of twenty-eight hastas.

analyzed: dairghyam tad aṣṭa māṃsena caturviṃśati paścimam
translated: Its length should be eight hastas less, making twenty-four hastas.

original: vistarāt ṣaṣṭhamāṃsena dairghyaṃ tasya prakīrtitaṃ /🔽uttaraṃ viṃśahastena caturthāṃsena dīrghataḥ //
analyzed: vistarāt ṣaṣṭha māṃsena dairghyam tasya prakīrtitam  uttaram viṃśa hastena caturtha aṃsena dīrghataḥ
translated: The breadth of the western house is said to be six hastas less.🔽The northern house should have a breadth of twenty hastas and a length of five hastas less.

analyzed: kṣatriyasya ca bhavet
translated: The first house of a Kshatriya should have a breadth of twenty-four hastas.

analyzed: dairghyanta daṣṭa māṃsena caturviṃśati dakṣiṇam
translated: The southern house should have a length of eight hastas less, making twenty-four hastas.

original: vistaraṃ ṣaṣṭhamāṃsena dairghyaṃ tasya prakalpayet /🔽paścimaṃ viṃśahastena dīrghantanturya māṃsataḥ //
analyzed: vistaram ṣaṣṭha māṃsena dairghyam tasya prakalpayet  paścimam viṃśa hastena māṃsataḥ
translated: The breadth of the western house should be six hastas less.🔽The northern house should have a breadth of twenty hastas and a length of four hastas less.

analyzed: uttaram ṣoḍaśe nā eva vistaraḥ ca prakīrtitam
translated: The breadth of the northern house is declared to be sixteen hastas.

analyzed: vistārāt pakṣa vat dairghyam śṛṇu
translated: The length should be like the wings, as before. Now listen to the measurements of the houses of Vaishyas.

analyzed: prāk caturviṃśa hastena ṣaṣṭha māṃsena dīrghataḥ
translated: The eastern house should have a breadth of twenty-four hastas and a length of six hastas less.

analyzed: dakṣiṇam viśam hastena māṃsataḥ
translated: The southern house should be one and a half times the length of the northern house.

analyzed: paścima ṣoḍaśe na eva tṛtīya aṃsena dīrgha tā
translated: The western house should be sixteen parts, with a length of three parts.

analyzed: caturdaśa kareṇa eva vistaram ca uttaram gṛham
translated: The northern house should have a width of fourteen cubits.

original: tadarddhe naiva dīrghaṃ tu śūdrasyaiva śṛṇu priye /
analyzed: tad arddhe nā eva dīrgham tu śūdrasya eva śṛṇu priye
translated: O Beloved, listen to the dimensions of the Śūdra's house.

analyzed: vistaram viṃśa hastena dīrgham tam turya māṃsataḥ
translated: The width should be twenty cubits, and the length should be four parts.

analyzed: prāc mukha udak mukham ca api yugmam ca api prakalpayet
translated: One should construct the house facing east or north, or both.

original: catuḥśālaṃ na tasyaiva gaurthe vā kuṭikāgrataḥ //
analyzed: catuḥśālam na tasya eva gaurthe vā kuṭikā agratas
translated: For him, there should not be a four-hall house, or a hut in front of the house.

original: āpaṃ yatra nalebhye tatrā syādanu pūrvataḥ /
analyzed: āpam yatra nalebhye tatra syāt anu pūrvatas
translated: Where water does not flow, there should be a well in the east.

original: yaduktaṃ gṛhavarṇānāṃ nyūnaṃ vāpyadhikaṃ na hi //🔽bhūpālasya gṛhaṃ vakṣye nandikāvartalakṣaṇa /
analyzed: yat uktam gṛha varṇānām nyūnam vā api adhikam na hi  bhūpālasya gṛham vakṣye nandikāvarta lakṣaṇa
translated: It is said that for the houses of the different castes, there should not be any deficiency or excess.🔽O Nandi, I will now describe the house of the king, which has the characteristics of a Nandīvartta.

analyzed: sva matam navadhā bhājyaḥ ekāśīti pada anvitam
translated: It should be divided into nine parts according to one's own opinion, and should have eighty-one squares.

original: āsthānamaṇḍapo nābhau padāṣṭaka paribhramaḥ /🔽🔽pūjāmaṇḍapa iśesyādiṣṭa deva prapūjanaṃ /
analyzed: āsthāna maṇḍapaḥ nābhau pada aṣṭaka paribhramaḥ  Ro pūjā maṇḍape deva prapūjanam
translated: The assembly hall should be in the center, surrounded by eight squares.🔽The worship hall should be in the northeast, where the presiding deity is worshipped.

analyzed: tad dakṣiṇe gṛham ca eva vastrāṇā nilayam priye
translated: To the south of that, O Beloved, there should be a house for storing clothes.

original: padamekaṃ pathasyārthe prāgāpye tu na saṃśayaḥ /🔽prākpathayāsyage nyasya hemādyā bharaṇāni ca //
analyzed: padam ekam pathasya arthe prāc āpye tu na saṃśayaḥ  prāk pathayā āsya ge nyasya hema ādyāḥ bharaṇāni ca
translated: One step is enough for the purpose of the path, but there is no doubt in the case of the prior path.🔽The ornaments of gold etc. should be placed in the prior path and in the east.

analyzed: khavite ratna saṃsthānam tad āpye gaṇikā āśrayaḥ
translated: The arrangement of jewels is in the sky, and the abode of the courtesan is in the prior path.

original: tasyāpyāya gataṃ caiva svakīyaṃ svayanaṃ gṛhaṃ //
analyzed: tasya āpyāya gatam ca eva svakīyam svayanam gṛham
translated: The house of one's own wife is also in the prior path.

analyzed: tribhaumam pañcabhaumam vā sapta bhaumam atha api vā
translated: It should be three-storied, five-storied, or even seven-storied.

original: vimānena tu vandhena surūpaṃ śikhariṇaṃ yathā //
analyzed: vimānena tu vandhena surūpam śikhariṇam yathā
translated: Like a beautiful mountain peak, with a house that is like a flying palace.

original: tadvāme ca mahārajñā gṛhaṃ syād valabhīyatha /🔽indre cāntaḥ purāvāsaṃ tatsaumye tu mahallakaṃ //
analyzed: tad vāme ca gṛham syāt  indre ca antar pura āvāsam tat saumye tu mahallakam
translated: To the left of that, the house of the great king should be like a pavilion.🔽In the east, the residence of the inner quarters, and to the north of that, the great hall.

analyzed: yathā uttare prakartavyam pramadānām gṛha uttamam
translated: The best house of the women should be made in the north.

analyzed: rudra sthāne tu karpūram karkola ādyāni veśanam
translated: In the place of Rudra, camphor and betel nuts etc. should be placed.

original: tasya pūrve punārajñī gṛhaṃ caiva suśobhana /🔽āsthānāduttare nyāsaṃ sarvadravyālayaṃvaraṃ //
analyzed: tasya pūrve gṛham ca eva su śobhana  āsthānāt uttare nyāsam sarva dravya ālayaṃvaram
translated: To the east of that, the very beautiful house of the queen.🔽The excellent house for keeping all liquids should be placed to the north of the assembly hall.

analyzed: nyāsa pūrve prakartavyam karṇa utsāra gṛham śubham
translated: The auspicious house for the removal of thorns should be made to the east of the assembly hall.

original: prākārāntaritaṃ sarvaṃ yā rekhā tatra saṃbhavet //
analyzed: prākāra antaritam sarvam yā rekhā tatra saṃbhavet
translated: All of it should be enclosed by a wall, and the line should be drawn there.

original: punarvāhye padaṃ tyajya vrajanārthaṃ samaṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: punar vāhye padam tyajya vrajana artham samam tatas
translated: Again, abandoning the external step, for the sake of going, it is the same.

original: vāhye nyāsaṃ punardevi tatreśe śāntikaṃ gṛhaṃ //
analyzed: vāhye nyāsam punar devi tatra īśe śāntikam gṛham
translated: Again, O Goddess, the external deposition, there in the house of peace,

original: madhye kuṇḍaṃ prakartavyaṃ dvihastaṃdyagulānvitaṃ /🔽mekhalaikānvitaṃ caiva vasusaṃkhyāṃgulairbhavet //🔽yonimadhye prakartavyo vistṛto dvādaśāṃgulaḥ /
analyzed: madhye kuṇḍam prakartavyam  mekhalā eka anvitam ca eva vasu saṃkhyā aṃgulaiḥ bhavet  yoni madhye prakartavyaḥ vistṛtaḥ dvādaśa aṃgulaḥ
translated: The pit should be made in the middle, two cubits long and one finger wide.🔽It should be endowed with one girdle and have the measure of eight fingers.🔽In the middle of the womb, it should be made, twelve fingers wide.

analyzed: dairghyāḥ dvis aṣṭa uddiṣṭaḥ mekhalā sārdham aṃgulā
translated: The length is said to be eighteen fingers, with half a finger for the girdle.

original: dvyaṅgulāgre praṇālaḥ syāt pṛṣṭhe kumbha dvayānvitaḥ /
analyzed: dvi aṅgula agre praṇālaḥ syāt pṛṣṭhe kumbha dvaya anvitaḥ
translated: The spout should be two fingers at the tip, and at the back, it should have two pots.

original: caturasraṃ punarmadhye mekhalā cāṅgulā bhavet //🔽antaḥkāṇḍanivaddhorddhe lohaśṛṃkhalalambitāṃ /🔽ghṛtapūrṇaghaṭatāmro ghaṭādhaḥ suṣirānvitaḥ //
analyzed: catur asram punar madhye mekhalā ca aṅgulā bhavet  antar kāṇḍa nivaddha ūrddhe loha śṛṃkhala lambitām  ghṛta pūrṇa ghaṭa tāmraḥ ghaṭa adhas suṣira anvitaḥ
translated: Again, in the middle, the girdle should be one finger.🔽Above, it should be tied with an inner stick, hanging with an iron chain.🔽Below the pot, filled with ghee, there should be a hole.

original: suṣiraṃ darbhamātra tuṃ ghṛtanirgamanāya ca /🔽yathā vicchinnadhārāñca dinarātriṃ tathā kuru //
analyzed: suṣiram darbha mātra tum ghṛta nirgamanāya ca  yathā vicchinna dhārām ca dina rātrim tathā kuru
translated: The hole should be the size of a darbha blade, for the ghee to flow out.🔽Make it so that the stream is not interrupted, both during the day and night.

analyzed: viprāḥ atra pāṭhakāḥ
translated: At night, the reciters should recite the peace mantras from the Rig, Yajur, and Sama Vedas.

analyzed: devi nityam triṣkāla pālanā
translated: O Goddess, the Hotar priest should always protect the three times.

original: rājñā te ca sadā pālyāsteṣāṃ puṣkalaśāsanaṃ /
analyzed: rājñā te ca sadā pālyāḥ teṣām puṣkala śāsanam
translated: They should always be protected by the king, and their extensive rules should be followed.

original: śānti dhārā gṛhaṃ hyetad vasudhārā gṛhaṃ hi tat //
analyzed: śānti dhārā gṛham hi etat vasu dhārā gṛham hi tat
translated: This is the house of the stream of peace, and that is the house of the stream of wealth.

analyzed: sva aṅka ādi dhvaja mālāḥ tu gaṅgā yamunam eva ca  Ro
translated: The flag and garland should be placed on one's own side, and the Ganges and Yamuna rivers.

analyzed: hema daṇḍam māyūra ādyam ca cāmaram
translated: The golden-handled sharp umbrella, the peacock-bannered chowries,

original: parjanye tu gṛhaṃ kṛtvā tatrasthāpyaṃ prayatnataḥ //
analyzed: parjanye tu gṛham kṛtvā tatra sthāpyam prayatnataḥ
translated: Having made the house in the Parjanya direction, it should be carefully placed there.

analyzed: sannāha ādyam tathā eva ca
translated: And the horse-equipment, the armor, and so on, should also be placed there.

analyzed: japa sthāne gṛham kṛtvā sthāpitavyam sadā vudhaiḥ
translated: Having made a house in the place of muttering, it should always be placed by the weapons.

original: sarvādhi karaṇaṃ caiva māhendre ca sadā bhavet /
analyzed: karaṇam ca eva māhendre ca sadā bhavet
translated: And the means of all knowledge should always be in the Mahesha direction.

original: ādityena bhaven mārgo mārgo dve tu ghaṭī gṛhaṃ //
analyzed: ādityena bhavet mārgaḥ mārgaḥ dve tu ghaṭī gṛham
translated: The path should be made by the sun, and the path should be made by the two ghatis.
The court of justice should be in the truth direction, and the examination of lawsuits should be done there.

original: bhṛśaṃ sthāne gṛhaṃ kṛtvā sthāpitavyaṃ vṛṣottamaṃ //
analyzed: bhṛśam sthāne gṛham kṛtvā sthāpitavyam vṛṣa uttamam
translated: Having made a house in the Bhrishana direction, the best bull should be placed there.

original: antarikṣegni dhāme ca kuryāt tatra mahānasaṃ /
analyzed: ca kuryāt tatra mahānasam
translated: And in the Antariksha and Agni-Dhaman directions, the great kitchen should be made.

analyzed: bhojya pātrāṇi vai puṣṇi yat trika ādyāḥ niveśanam
translated: The food vessels should be placed in the Pushan direction, and the residence of the Yattra and others.

analyzed: vitathe ca eva kartavyaḥ sacivā sthānamaṇḍapaḥ
translated: And in the Vitatha direction, the pavilion for the ministers should be made.

analyzed: gṛha kṣatre prakartavyā ujina śālā na saṃśayaḥ
translated: The quarters of the warriors should be made in the house and the warrior quarters, there is no doubt.

analyzed: aṅga rakṣā āśrayaḥ cai yame nityam sadā bhavet
translated: The place for the protection of the limbs should always be in the northeast.

analyzed: sthānam vīṇā vādya ādi saṃgraham
translated: The place for the singers of Gandharva music, the collection of Vīṇā and other musical instruments,

analyzed: bhṛṅga sthāne prakartavyam senāpati gṛham śubham
translated: The auspicious house of the commander of the army should be made in the place of Bhṛṅga.

original: mṛgasthāne gṛhaṃ kṛtvā kastūryādi niveśanaṃ //🔽pitṛsthāne prakartavyasaṃvaśyakagṛhaṃ subhaṃ /
analyzed: mṛga sthāne gṛham kṛtvā kastūrī ādi niveśanam  pitṛsthāne prakartavya saṃvaśyaka gṛham subham
translated: Having made the house in the place of Mṛga, the dwelling of musk and other things,🔽The auspicious house of the assembly should be made in the place of the manes.

analyzed: dvau vārike prakartavyaḥ majjana āśrayaḥ uttamā
translated: The two excellent places for bathing should be made in the two Vārikas.

original: pratīhāragṛhaṃ caiva sugrīve ca sadā bhavet /
analyzed: pratīhāra gṛham ca eva sugrīve ca sadā bhavet
translated: The house of the doorkeeper should always be in the Sugrīva,

analyzed: puṣpadante prakartavyaḥ bhojana āśrayaḥ uttamam
translated: The excellent place for eating should be made in the Puṣpadanta,

analyzed: pracetasi tathā āmārgaḥ kartavyaḥ tu su śobhane
translated: And the road should be made very beautiful in the Pracetas.

original: asure talavargasya gṛhaṃ caiva sadā bhavet //
analyzed: asure tala vargasya gṛham ca eva sadā bhavet
translated: The house of the Tala class of Asuras should always be in the Asura.

original: śoṣe vai śastraśālā ca cchurikādyā niveśanaṃ /
analyzed: śoṣe vai śastra śālā ca churikā ādyāḥ niveśanam
translated: The weapons hall and the dwelling of the daggers etc. should be in the Shoṣa.

original: roge vā gogṛśālaṃ ca vaidyasthānaṃ sadā bhavet //
analyzed: roge vā go gṛśālam ca vaidya sthānam sadā bhavet
translated: The cow shed and the place of the physician should always be in the Roga.

original: bhṛṣaśārvā prakartavyā vāyo nityaṃ na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: bhṛṣa śārvā prakartavyā vāyo nityam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: The place for the horses should always be made in the Vāyu, there is no doubt.
The house of the couple and the description of the rubies etc. should be in the Nāga place.

analyzed: ekaḥ ca eva tathā bhadre puṣpāśraya dvitīyake
translated: O Bhadra, the first one should be a single room, and the second one should be a flower-chamber.

original: sumukhārddhaprakartavyaṃ rājadvau vārika gṛhaṃ //🔽mayūraṃ kukkuṭārdhe tu kartavyaṃ tu gṛhaṃ śubhaṃ /
analyzed: sumukha arddha prakartavyam rāja dvau gṛham  mayūram kukkuṭa ardhe tu kartavyam tu gṛham śubham
translated: The royal gate should be made half-moon shaped, and the water-chamber should be made in the shape of a peacock.🔽The auspicious house should be made in the shape of a cock.

analyzed: bhaṇḍāgāram ca bhalvāṭe sarva śasya ālayaṃvaram
translated: The granary should be made in the shape of a buffalo, and the excellent storehouse of all grains should be made in the shape of a cow.

analyzed: ghṛta ādi lavaṇa ādyāḥ ca tatra sthāpyā prayatnataḥ
translated: Ghee and salt etc. should be carefully placed there.

analyzed: somasthāne mahā śālā rājahasti niveśanam
translated: In the place of Soma, the great hall and the royal elephant's stable should be made.

original: aśvaśālarigau bhadre yasmin rājā svayaṃ ruhet /🔽🔽aditau gṛhayugmaṃ tu mahiṣāścoraṇā priye /
analyzed: aśva śāla rigau bhadre yasmin rājā svayam ruhet  Ro aditau gṛha yugmam tu mahiṣāḥ coraṇā priye
translated: O Bhadra, the horse stable should be made in the shape of a bull, in which the king himself should reside.🔽O Beloved, in the place of Aditi, two houses should be made, and buffaloes and goats should be kept there.

original: diti sthāne gṛhaṃ tadvat dhenuvidyāśrayaṃ yugaṃ //
analyzed: diti sthāne gṛham tadvat dhenu vidyā āśrayam yugam
translated: In the place of Diti, a house should be made in the same way, and a pair of cows and a school should be established there.

analyzed: rāja putra ādi saṃyuktam upādhyāya niveśanam
translated: The house of the preceptor should be endowed with princes etc.

analyzed: prakāra antaritā atra api pūrvavat samudāhṛtam
translated: Here also, the other parts are said to be as before.

analyzed: pūrva dvāre jayaḥ prokta dakṣiṇe śayana uttamam
translated: Victory is said to be in the eastern gate, and the excellent bed is in the southern gate.

analyzed: āsthānam prāc mukha bhadre nityam eva samācaret  nibhṛtāyyam tat ādvāram apadvāram tat ucyate
translated: O Bhadra, the royal audience should always be held facing the east.🔽That gate is called the main gate, and the other gate is called the side gate.

analyzed: no ced tat vāhanam mūlam tad āya dvāra pūrvakam
translated: If not, then the vehicle is the main thing, preceded by the main gate.

analyzed: mukham tadvat śayanam ca uttaret tadā
translated: The court, the palace, and the bedchamber should be located in the north.

analyzed: bhāṇḍāgāram tadā yāmye yā yathā aśeṣa saṃsthitiḥ
translated: The treasury should be in the south, as per the remaining arrangement.

analyzed: āsthāna nyāśa śayanam calanam tu vidhīyate
translated: The court, the palace, and the bedchamber should be located in the north.

analyzed: puram dviguṇa vat vāhye prākāra antaritam bhavet
translated: The city should be twice as large as the palace, surrounded by an outer wall.

analyzed: bhavet
translated: Going through the main gate, it should face the pair of Fattas.

original: vaṇik pratrādi sauvarṇī yeṣāṃ rakṣottamātra tu //
analyzed: sauvarṇī yeṣām rakṣā uttamā atra tu
translated: The goldsmiths and others are the best protectors of those whose wealth is in gold.

original: yāme veśyāstu yā rakṣyā rājābhigamanāstu yat /
analyzed: yāme veśyāḥ tu yāḥ rakṣyāḥ rāja abhigamanāḥ tu yat
translated: In the third quarter, the prostitutes should be protected, and they should visit the king.

analyzed: tatra api abhi kalpanā
translated: Even there, the arrangement of the house and its length should be made facing them.

original: paścime karma veśyāstu bhṛtyā yena sthitirna hi /
analyzed: paścime karma veśyāḥ tu bhṛtyāḥ yena sthitiḥ na hi
translated: In the west, the prostitutes should be engaged in work, as they do not have a permanent residence.

analyzed: uttare dīrgha eka ārāmam śubham
translated: In the north, the house should be long and pleasant, adorned with lotuses and lilies.

analyzed: tadvat vāhye punar kalpya prākāra antaritam priye
translated: Similarly, O beloved, outside again, it should be surrounded by an outer wall.

original: pūrve vai brāhmaṇā vāsaṃ kṣatriyāvāsa cāntake //🔽vaiśyānāvāyyadigbhāge śūdrāṇāṃ tu tathottare /
analyzed: pūrve vai brāhmaṇāḥ vāsam ca antake  vaiśya anāvāyya digbhāge śūdrāṇām tu tathā uttare
translated: In the east, the Brahmins should reside, and the Kshatriyas in the west.🔽The Vaishyas in the south-west, and the Shudras in the north.

analyzed: nairṛtye śuṇḍika āditaḥ
translated: The blacksmiths and others in the south-east, and the wine-sellers and others in the south-west.

original: vāyavyāṃ hastikādīnāmaiśānyāṃ prakṛtiṃ nyaset /🔽punarvāhye tathā bhūtaṃ koṭṭaṃ vāhye prakalpayet //
analyzed: vāyavyām hastika ādīnām aiśānyām prakṛtim nyaset  punar vāhye tathā bhūtam koṭṭam vāhye prakalpayet
translated: In the northwest, one should place the elephant and other animals, and in the northeast, the natural elements.🔽Again, outside, one should arrange the outer fort as before,

analyzed: pūrvavat kathite nā eva pratrāṭbhālaka saṃyutam
translated: with the same number of gates and arches.

analyzed: vividha āvāsa saṃyuktam phaṭṭam vividha carcitam
translated: Endowed with various abodes, the fort is adorned in various ways.

analyzed: rāja nirmitam
translated: The king has built the fort, with the lord of arts as the architect.

analyzed: mūla dvāre tu ye pālāḥ dvis aṣṭa kara daṇḍikā
translated: The guardians at the main gate have sixteen arms each,

original: khaḍgahastāśatā pañca dhanuhastāstathaiva ca /🔽dvitīye dvisvaraḥ pālāḥ khaḍgahastāḥ śatatrayaṃ //
analyzed: pañca dhanu hastāḥ tathā eva ca  dvitīye dvi svaraḥ pālāḥ khaḍga hastāḥ śata trayam
translated: five hundred sword-wielding guards, and the same number with bows.🔽In the second, the guards are twice as many, with three hundred sword-wielding guards.

analyzed: tṛtīya sūryavat pālā khaḍga hastāḥ śata dvayam
translated: In the third, the guards are as many as the sun's rays, with two hundred sword-wielding guards.

analyzed: caturthe dviṣavat pālāḥ śatasārddhāḥ tu rakṣaṇāḥ  Ro
translated: In the fourth, the guards are twice as many as the sun's rays, with one hundred and fifty guards.

analyzed: pañcame vasu vat pālāḥ śastriṇā śatam eva ca
translated: In the fifth, the guards are as many as the Vasus, with one hundred armed guards.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭhame ṛtu vat pālāḥ sa āyudhā aśīti rucyate
translated: In the sixth, the guards are as many as the seasons, with eighty armed guards mentioned.

original: catuḥpālā vinirdiṣṭā dvāre caiva tu saptame /
analyzed: catuṣpālāḥ vinirdiṣṭāḥ dvāre ca eva tu saptame
translated: The guards are said to be four times in the seventh gate,

analyzed: śata arddha rakṣaṇāḥ tatra khaḍga hasta asuyodhanāḥ
translated: with half a hundred guards there, sword-wielding and well-equipped.

analyzed: su śūrāḥ satva saṃpannā svāmi bhaktāḥ tu sarvadā
translated: They are very brave, endowed with courage, and always devoted to the king.

analyzed: vicitra pura vinyāsam sapta prākāra saṃyutam
translated: The layout of the city with seven ramparts,

analyzed: mahā rāja adhirājasya kathitam tava suvrate
translated: Has been described to you, O one of good vows, for the great emperor.

original: sāmānyasya narendrasya dvitīyaṃ nandikocyate //🔽devasaṃsthiti pākañca śayanaṃ yā yudāśrayaṃ /
analyzed: sāmānyasya narendrasya dvitīyam nandikā ucyate  śayanam
translated: For the ordinary king, the second Nandaka is described.🔽The abode of the gods, the kitchen, the bed, the residence,

analyzed: bhojanam patra bhāṇḍāram prākāra ante prakalpayet
translated: The dining hall, and the treasury should be located outside the rampart.

analyzed: aiśa ādyam ca uttarām tantu prāmāṇam adhunā ucyate  aṣṭottaraśatena ekara saṃsthitiḥ eva ca
translated: Now the dimensions of the quarters beginning with the northeast are being stated.🔽The abode of the gods should be one hundred and eight cubits.

original: tatpādena bhaved dairghya śayanaṃ karaśatena tu /🔽karadvānavati prokta bhojanaṃ pādadīrghataḥ //
analyzed: tad pādena bhavet dairghya śayanam kara śatena tu  bhojanam pāda dīrghataḥ
translated: The bed should be four cubits long and one hundred cubits.🔽The dining hall is said to be twenty cubits long and four cubits wide.

original: turyāśīti kareṇaiva bhāṇḍāgāravidurvudhāḥ /🔽catuḥpañcāśadvahastena pākaṃ pāda sudīrghataḥ //

translated: Om, salutations to the all-pervading, stable, unshakable, firm, Hrīṃ Laṃ Hrīṃ Svāhā.

original: svaguṇeyaṃ samākhyātā prāguktaṃ parameṣṭhinā /🔽vyāpti dhyānāśrayobhūtvā samatvaṃ sarvagaṃ paraṃ //
analyzed: sva guṇā iyam samākhyātā prāk uktam parameṣṭhinā  vyāpti dhyāna āśrayaḥ bhūtvā samatvam sarvagam param
translated: This is said to be one's own quality, as stated by the supreme lord earlier.🔽Having become the support of all-pervasiveness and meditation, one should contemplate the supreme all-pervading.

analyzed: sa avaṣṭambha sthira adhvānam yadā iṣṭam
translated: One should place the desired thought in the stable path with support.

analyzed: ādhāra ādheyam bhāvaḥ ucyate
translated: The union of the support and the supported is said to be the state.

analyzed: ādhāra ananta śaktiḥ tu ādheyaḥ tu paraḥ śivaḥ
translated: The support is the infinite power, and the supported is the supreme Śiva.

original: gandhapuṣpādibhiḥ pūjya yugme naiva tu rodhayet //
analyzed: gandha puṣpa ādibhiḥ pūjya yugme nā eva tu rodhayet
translated: One should worship with incense, flowers, etc., and block the pair.

original: pūrvaṃ yat kalpitaṃ svabhraṃ tatra ratnāni vinyaset /
analyzed: pūrvam yat kalpitam svabhram tatra ratnāni vinyaset
translated: One should place the jewels in the self-pit that was prepared earlier.

analyzed: pūrvasu abhre nyaset vajram sūryakātam ca pāvake  Ro
translated: One should place the diamond in the eastern self-pit, and the sun-crystal in the south.

original: indranīlaṃ nyased yāmye mahānīlaṃ ca nairṛte /
analyzed: indranīlam nyaset yāmye mahānīlam ca nairṛte
translated: One should place the sapphire in the south-east, and the great sapphire in the south-west.

analyzed: mauktikantu nyaset devi vāruṇe svabhra maṇḍale
translated: One should place the pearl, O Goddess, in the west in the self-pit circle.

analyzed: puṣparāgam tu vāyavyām padmarāgam tathā uttare
translated: One should place the ruby in the north-west, and the ruby in the north.

analyzed: vaiḍūryam īśa digbhāge madhye sarvāṇi vinyaset
translated: One should place the lapis lazuli in the north-east, and all of them in the middle.

analyzed: evam ca anukrameṇa eva nyaset ratnāni sūriṇaḥ
translated: In this order, the wise one should deposit the gems.

analyzed: ratna nyāsāt punar bhūyas loha nyāsam samācaret
translated: After the deposition of gems, one should again perform the deposition of metals.

original: kāñcanañca nyaset pūrve tāmraṃ caivāgni gocare /🔽āyasaṃyāmyadigbhāge nairṛtyāṃtrapuṣaṃ nyaset //🔽prācetasi diśābhāge tāracaiva tu vinyaset /🔽rītikāmbāyudigbhāge saumyaghāṣañca vinyaset //
analyzed: kāñcanañca nyaset pūrve tāmram ca eva agni gocare  āya saṃyāmya digbhāge nairṛtyāṃ trapuṣam nyaset  prācetasi diśā bhāge tāra ca eva tu vinyaset  vinyaset
translated: Gold should be deposited in the east, and copper in the southeast.🔽Iron should be deposited in the west, and tin in the southwest.🔽In the northeast, one should deposit lead.

original: aiśānyāñca nyasetasīśaṃ punapāśāṇakaṃ nyaset /🔽haritālaṃ nyaset pūrve pāvake cchilāṃ //
analyzed: aiśānyām ca nyaset asi īśam nyaset  haritālam nyaset pūrve pāvake
translated: Red arsenic should be deposited in the northwest, and silver in the north.🔽Iron pyrite should be deposited in the northeast, and quartz should be deposited in the southeast.🔽Realgar should be deposited in the east, and mica in the southeast.

analyzed: nyaset
translated: Realgar should be deposited in the west, and quartz should be deposited in the southwest.

original: ramendravāruṇe nyasya vāyavyāṃ caiva kathyate //🔽sauvarṇagairikā devi nyastavyā nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: ramendra vāruṇe nyasya vāyavyām ca eva kathyate  sauvarṇagairikā devi nyastavyā na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: Silver should be deposited in the north, and it is said that gold and red ochre should be deposited in the northwest.

analyzed: gandha pāśāṇakam saume bhṛṅgam īśāna gocare
translated: O Goddess, there is no doubt that red ochre should be deposited in the north, and bees-wax in the northeast.

analyzed: loha pāśāṇayoḥ devi mātrām ca eva tu vinyaset
translated: O Goddess, one should deposit the measures of metals and stones.

analyzed: punar anyāni mūlāni nyastavyāni yathā śṛṇu
translated: Listen again to the other roots that should be deposited.

analyzed: uṣīram pūrvatas nyasya viṣṇu krānta agni gocare
translated: Ushīra should be deposited in the east, and Viṣṇukrāntā in the southeast.

original: raktacandanayāmye tu paitre kṛṣṇāguruntathā //🔽śveta candana vāruṇyāṃ sārikotpalavāyave /
analyzed: raktacandana yāmye tu paitre kṛṣṇa agurum tathā  śveta candana vāruṇyām sārikā utpala vāyave
translated: Red sandalwood in the south, black aloe in the west,🔽White sandalwood in the northwest, and blue lotus in the north.

analyzed: saumye kuṇḍam ca vinyasya śaṃkha puṣpa āśa gocare
translated: Having placed the sacrificial pit in the northeast, one should place the conch and flowers in the southeast.

original: mūlaṃ samyak vinyasya punaḥ saśyañca vinyaset /
analyzed: mūlam samyak vinyasya punar vinyaset
translated: Having properly placed the root, one should again place the sprouts.

original: dhānyaṃ pūrve ca vinyasya godhūmāṃ cāgni gocare //🔽yāmya tilān vinyasya māṣaṃ nairṛtya gocare /🔽suṅgaṃ / vāruṇadigbhāge vāyavyāñca yavaṃ nyaset //
analyzed: dhānyam pūrve ca vinyasya godhūmām ca agni gocare  tilān vinyasya māṣam nairṛtya gocare  suṅgam vāruṇa digbhāge yavam nyaset
translated: Having placed grains in the east, and wheat in the southeast,🔽Having placed sesame seeds in the south, and beans in the southwest,🔽One should place sugarcane in the west, and barley in the northwest.

original: saumya nīvārakaṃ nyasya syāmāmīśānagocare /🔽sarvadhānyaṃ nyasen madhye sarvamūlantathaiva ca //
analyzed: saumya nīvārakam nyasya syāma ām īśāna gocare  sarva dhānyam nyaset madhye sarva mūlam tathā eva ca
translated: Having placed wild rice in the north, and black gram in the northeast,🔽One should place all grains in the middle, as well as all roots.

analyzed: sarva pāṣāṇa lohān ca nyaset madhye tu suvrate
translated: O One of Good Vows! One should place all stones and metals in the middle.

original: punarmadhye nyaset pṛṣṭī vṛṣaṃ kurmadhā nyaset //🔽sarvāñcāpyatha vā hyekaṃ sauvarṇena tu nirmita /
analyzed: punar madhye nyaset pṛṣṭī vṛṣam nyaset  sarvān ca api atha vā hi ekam sauvarṇena tu
translated: Again, in the middle, one should place the tortoise, and place the bull.🔽All of them, or just one, made of gold,

analyzed: sarveṣām ca āmi abhāve tu nyaset ekam tu pādaram  Ro
translated: Or, in the absence of all, one should place just one foot.

original: vījagāḍhaṃ na kartavyaṃ mūlagāḍhaṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: vīja gāḍham na kartavyam mūla gāḍham tathā eva ca
translated: The seed should not be made too thick, nor the root.

analyzed: gāḍhe nā eva mahā doṣaḥ tasmāt mātrām pradāpayet
translated: If it is very deep, there is a great fault, therefore, one should give the proper amount.

analyzed: dīptiḥ tṛpti smṛtiḥ ca eva roga nāsā catuṣṭayam
translated: Radiance, satisfaction, memory, and the fourfold cure of diseases,

analyzed: taiḥ yuktā ananta śaktiḥ tu vidye ca suvrate
translated: Endowed with these, the knowledge has infinite power, O Suvrata.

original: dharāntaṃ dhyānamālavya nyayet sarvākṣareṇa vā /🔽pāyasenoparilepya netravastreṇa chādayet //
analyzed: dharā antam dhyāna mālavya sarva akṣareṇa vā  pāyasena upari lepya netra vastreṇa chādayet
translated: Having recited the dhāraṇā up to the end of the earth, one should offer it with all the syllables.🔽Having smeared it with milk pudding, one should cover it with a cloth for the eyes.

analyzed: prati liṅgam ārabheta śvabhre pīṭhavandham samācaret
translated: One should begin with each liṅga, and perform the binding of the pedestal in the pit.

original: pṛthak pīṭhaṃ yadā bhadre tadainaṃ vidhimācaret //
analyzed: pṛthak pīṭham yadā bhadre tadā enam vidhim ācaret
translated: If the pedestal is separate, O Bhadrā, then one should perform this rite.

analyzed: no ced piṇḍitam pīṭham tu pratiliṅgam ārabhet nahi  vastra yugmena saṃcchādya śikhā mantreṇa suvrate
translated: If not, then the pedestal is combined, and one should not begin with each liṅga.🔽Having covered it with a pair of cloths, O Suvrata, with the mantra of the tuft,

analyzed: gandha puṣpa ādibhiḥ pūjya viśuddhena antarātmanā
translated: Having worshipped with incense, flowers, etc., with a pure inner self,

original: varmaṇārodhikaṃ kṛtvā khaḍge naiva tu rodhayet //
analyzed: varmaṇā ārodhikam kṛtvā khaḍge nā eva tu rodhayet
translated: Having made the protection with the armor, one should block it with the sword alone.

original: nirvatyeva punarvāhye tat sthāne digvaliṃ haret /
analyzed: punar vāhye tat sthāne digvalim haret
translated: Having offered again outside, one should take the bali offering in that place.

original: dikpatibhyo valiṃ datvā samyagā camya yatnataḥ //
analyzed: dikpatibhyaḥ valim da tvā samyak ā camya yatnataḥ
translated: Having given the bali offering to the lords of the directions, having sipped water properly with effort,

original: punarāgatya kuṇḍe tu home paścāt samārabhet /
analyzed: punar āgatya kuṇḍe tu home paścāt samārabhet
translated: Having returned again to the pit, one should commence the homa afterwards.

analyzed: kimartham ca itat vātavyam śilā sūtra viśodhanam
translated: For what purpose should this be done - the purification of the stone thread?

analyzed: vāstu sūtra viśuddhyai prāyaściti artham juhuyāt
translated: For the purification of the vastu thread, one should offer oblations as an expiation.

original: śataṃ śataṃ śataṃ hutvā tatoliṅgaṃ prasādayet //🔽hṛdinotthāpayelliṅgaṃ te naivārghaṃ pradāpayet /
analyzed: śatam śatam śatam hutvā tatas liṅgam prasādayet  hṛdinā utthāpayet liṅgam te na eva argham pradāpayet
translated: Having offered one hundred oblations each, then one should propitiate the liṅga.🔽One should raise the liṅga with the heart mantra and not offer arghya.

analyzed: śirasā cālayet bhūyas tuti kṛtvā tu mantra vid
translated: The knower of mantras should again move it with the head, having done praise.

original: japaśabdā kulaṃ kṛtvā vedadhvanisamākulaṃ /🔽vandini ghoṣasaṃyuktaṃ strīṇāṃgeyasamanvitaṃ //
analyzed: japa śabdā kulam kṛtvā veda dhvani samākulam  vandini ghoṣa saṃyuktam strīṇām āṃgeya samanvitam
translated: Having made the sound of japa, filled with the sound of the Vedas,🔽accompanied by the sound of bards, endowed with the sound of women's songs,

analyzed: kaumāryā amaṅgalaiḥ yuktam yatīnām tava saṃyutam
translated: endowed with auspicious things of Kumārī, accompanied by the austerities of ascetics,

analyzed: svasti vākyam dvijaiḥ yuktam hilihila ākāra saṃyutam  saṃkhakāhala saṃyuktam vividhaiḥ vādya vāditaiḥ
translated: accompanied by the words of benediction by the twice-born, accompanied by the sound of hili hili,🔽accompanied by conches and kettledrums, with various musical instruments,

analyzed: puṣpa dhūpa ākulaiḥ dīpaiḥ cāmara ut kṣepa vījitaiḥ
translated: with flowers, incense, lamps, and the waving of yak-tail fans,

analyzed: ācārye na uddhṛtam devam mūrtipaiḥ saha saṃyutam
translated: the preceptor should raise the god along with the image-holders.

analyzed: kartā ca eva samāyuktam sakhāye pūrva kalpitam
translated: The performer should be accompanied by his friends, previously appointed.

analyzed: evam ca uddhṛtya gantavyam prāsādasya samīpatas
translated: Having thus raised it, one should go near the palace.

analyzed: pradakṣiṇa trayam kṛtvā dvāra sthānakam ānayet
translated: Having circumambulated three times, one should bring the door-keeper.

analyzed: aṣṭāṃga argham pradātavyam bhadrapīṭha sthitam śubham
translated: The eight-limbed offering should be given, auspicious, placed on an auspicious seat.

analyzed: mūrtipaiḥ ca argha dātavyam striyaḥ sarvāḥ ca rocanām
translated: The offering should be made by the priests, and all the women should offer saffron.

analyzed: akṣatam patinā saṃhaiḥ brāhmaṇaiḥ ca kuśa udakam  Ro
translated: Unhusked rice should be mixed with the husband, and the Brahmins with the water of Kusha grass.

analyzed: bhadrapīṭha sthitam kṛtvā dvāra garbha antare tu tam
translated: Having placed it on the auspicious seat, inside the door and womb,

analyzed: prāsādam ca yadā pūrvam tadā advāra praveśanam
translated: When the temple is new, the entrance should be made from the door.

original: praveśe tu na cādhorddha tiryagdvāraṃ spṛśet kvacit /
analyzed: praveśe tu na tiryak dvāram spṛśet kvacid
translated: But when entering, one should not touch the door below, above, or diagonally anywhere.

original: sparśanācca mahādoṣaḥ kārakāderbhavediha //🔽taddiśā homakartavyaṃ tanmantreṇaiva suvrate /
analyzed: sparśanāt ca mahā doṣaḥ kāraka ādeḥ bhavet iha  tad diśā homa kartavyam tad mantreṇa eva suvrate
translated: And by touching, there would be a great fault here for the performer.🔽Homa should be performed in that direction itself with that mantra, O one of good vows.

original: tadeva diśi kuṇḍe tu tadādhyakṣeṇa suvrate //
analyzed: tat eva diśi kuṇḍe tu tad adhyakṣeṇa suvrate
translated: That itself should be done in the pit in that direction by the supervisor, O one of good vows.

analyzed: śatam aṣṭa adhikam hutvā japan ca eva tathā bhavet
translated: Having offered one hundred and eight oblations, the japa should also be done in the same way.

original: tasya dānaṃ pradātavyaṃ vāhanaṃ taddiśocitaṃ //🔽ibhaṃcchāgaṃ mahīṣañca dāsaumakarameva ca /
analyzed: tasya dānam pradātavyam vāhanam tad diśā ucitam  ibham chāgam mahīṣam ca dāsau makaram eva ca
translated: That gift should be given, the vehicle suitable for that direction.🔽Elephant, goat, buffalo, servant, crocodile,

analyzed: mṛgovimānakaḥ ca eva valīvarddhā dvijādhipam
translated: Deer, chariot, and camel - these are the vehicles for the king of Brahmins.

analyzed: haṃsam pratyakṣatas dānam abhāva arddhema dadet
translated: To the swan, one should offer the gift of half a gold coin in the absence of a full one.

original: evaṃ kṛte bhavecchāntiḥ kārakādestu bhāvini //🔽ācāryodghāṭayecchubhraṃ yatpurāvastracchāditaṃ /
analyzed: evam kṛte bhavet śāntiḥ kāraka ādeḥ tu bhāvini  ācārya udghāṭayet śubhram yat purā vastra chāditam
translated: If this is done, there will be peace from the creator, O future one.🔽The preceptor should open the white cloth that was previously covered.

analyzed: recayet kavaca astram ca yat pūrvam tu nirodhitam
translated: One should release the armor and weapon that were previously restrained.

analyzed: mahā pāśupatāstreṇa yat purā kathitena tu
translated: By the great Pāśupata weapon that was previously mentioned,

analyzed: yantra stham dhārayet liṅgam madhyāt madhyam prasādhayet
translated: The liṅga that is in the machine should be held, and the middle should be purified from the middle.

original: sucihnairlambasūtraistu mūrtipaiśca samāvṛtaṃ /🔽yantrasthaṃ bhāvayet sandhāryaṃ yāvat prāguṇabhāgataḥ //
analyzed: su cihnaiḥ lamba sūtraiḥ tu mūrtipaiḥ ca samāvṛtam  yantra stham bhāvayet sandhāryam yāvat prāguṇa bhāgataḥ
translated: Surrounded by the lords of forms with long threads well marked,🔽The liṅga in the machine should be contemplated and held as long as the prior qualities are present.

analyzed: dhyātvā aśaktimataḥ śaktim vyavasthitām
translated: Having contemplated the power of the powerless one, established in the mind,

original: dhyānātītāntagaṃ kṛtvā tasmāt sṛṣṭyā niveśayet //🔽sthiro bhavati saṃsthāpya devā brahmaśilāmukhe /🔽svamantreṇa paraṃ dhāma dhyātvākāraṇakāraṇaṃ //
analyzed: dhyāna atīta anta gam kṛtvā tasmāt sṛṣṭyā niveśayet  sthiraḥ bhavati saṃsthāpya devāḥ brahmaśilā mukhe  sva mantreṇa param dhāma dhyātvā akāraṇa kāraṇam
translated: Having made it beyond meditation and the end, one should place it from that into creation.🔽Having contemplated the supreme abode, the cause of causes, with one's own mantra,

analyzed: tad dharma dhyāna saṃyojya cit acetasi vinyaset
translated: Having united it with the meditation on its nature, one should deposit it in the conscious and unconscious.

analyzed: viṣuve nā eva yogena cumbakaḥ su samāhitaḥ
translated: The uniter, well concentrated, by the yoga of the equinoctial,

analyzed: pīṭham niveśya tat paścāt gandha puṣpa ādibhiḥ yajet
translated: Having placed the pedestal, one should worship it with incense, flowers, etc.

analyzed: saṃrakṣa pīṭham liṅgantu carma astreṇa eva suvrate
translated: O One of Good Vows! Having protected the pedestal and the linga with the weapon mantra,

analyzed: punar āgatya hotavyam śatikaḥ doṣa śāntaye
translated: one should again come and offer oblations one hundred times to pacify the faults.

analyzed: utpāta ādi abhighāta artham yathā homam tathā japam
translated: For the purpose of averting calamities etc., one should do japa as per the homa.

analyzed: pūjya saṃstutya pūrvavat
translated: One should again worship the pedestal, praise it as before,

analyzed: mūrtipaiḥ cumbakaiḥ sārddham sahāyaiḥ kārakaiḥ sahaḥ
translated: along with the murtipas, chumbakas, assistants, and performers.

analyzed: gīta vādya ādikam kṛtvā  Ro
translated: Having performed singing, instrumental music, etc., with bards and brahmins,

analyzed: ūrddha adhastāt samānīya vidhinā pūrvavat yathā
translated: Having brought it from above and below, as per the rules as before,

analyzed: kṛtvā dvāra sthāne samāgatā
translated: having circumambulated three times, having come to the door place,

analyzed: rocanā argha akṣatam da tvā mūrtipaiḥ cumbakaiḥ sahaḥ
translated: having offered rocanaka, arghya, and akshata, along with the murtipas and chumbakas,

original: na saṃspṛśet tathādvāraṃ praveśyā caiva yatnataḥ //🔽praveśaṃ lambasūtrābhyāṃ vedīlakṣaṇalakṣitaṃ /
analyzed: na saṃspṛśet tathādvāram praveśyā ca eva yatnataḥ  praveśam lamba sūtrābhyām vedī lakṣaṇa lakṣitam
translated: one should not touch the door, and carefully enter.🔽The entrance is marked by two hanging threads, and is marked by the characteristics of the altar.

analyzed: samyak sādhya diśā bhāgam dakṣiṇāmūrti saṃsthitaḥ
translated: Situated in the southern direction, as per the prescribed method,

analyzed: praṇālam uttare kṛtvā kriyā sthāpanam ārabhet
translated: having made the water channel on the north, one should commence the installation rite.

original: sūkṣmakālātmakaṃ vedya ṛtukāle ca vīkṣayet //🔽dehe dehī yathāyogaṃstathā jñāne kriyāṃ nyaset /
analyzed: sūkṣma kāla ātmakam vedyaḥ ṛtu kāle ca vīkṣayet  dehe dehī yathāyogan tathā jñāne kriyām nyaset
translated: The knowable, which has the nature of subtle time, should be seen at the time of menstruation.🔽The embodied soul should be placed in the body as appropriate, and action should be placed in knowledge accordingly.

original: bhogo bhogī yathāyoga yuñjet jñāne kriyāntathā //
analyzed: bhogaḥ bhogī yathā yoga yuñjet jñāne kriyān tathā
translated: The enjoyer should be united with enjoyment as appropriate, and action should be placed in knowledge accordingly.

original: bodhakriyā niviṣṭaṃ tu jñeyaṃ jñānāsṛtaṃ yathā /
analyzed: bodha kriyāḥ niviṣṭam tu jñeyam jñāna āsṛtam yathā
translated: The object of knowledge, which is immersed in the action of awakening, should be known as dependent on knowledge.

analyzed: sūrya indra vimbayoḥ yadvat ekī bhūtā yathā kalām
translated: Just as the digits are united in the orb of the sun and the moon,

analyzed: tathā atra api smaritvā tu dṛkkriye saṃniveśayet
translated: in the same way, remembering this, one should unite the seer and action.

original: dehavat piṇḍikā jñeyā liṅgandehī ca kīrtitaṃ //
analyzed: deha vat piṇḍikā jñeyā liṅgandehī ca kīrtitam
translated: The pedestal should be known as having a body, and the linga is declared to be the embodied soul.

original: bhogavat piṇḍikā jñeyā liṅgabhogī ca nānyathā /
analyzed: bhoga vat piṇḍikā jñeyā liṅga bhogī ca nā anyathā
translated: The pedestal should be known as having enjoyment, and the linga is the enjoyer, not otherwise.

analyzed: jñāna vat piṇḍikā bhadre jñeya vat liṅgam ucyate
translated: The pedestal is said to be endowed with knowledge, and the linga is said to be endowed with the object of knowledge.

analyzed: indra vat piṇḍikā matye sūrya vat liṅgam ucyate
translated: The pedestal is said to be like Indra, and the linga is said to be like the sun.

original: kriyā dehe vasaṃ kalpya jñānaṃ dehī ca kalpyate //🔽bhogye vahi kriyā rūpaṃ jñānaṃ bhogī valakṣyate /
analyzed: kriyā dehe kalpya jñānam dehī ca kalpyate  bhogye kriyā rūpam jñānam bhogī
translated: Action is conceived to reside in the body, and knowledge is conceived to be the embodied soul.🔽The form of action is seen in the object of enjoyment, and the enjoyer is said to be characterized by knowledge.

original: kriyājñāne ca draṣṭavyā jñānaṃ jñeya ca dravyate //
analyzed: kriyā jñāne ca draṣṭavyāḥ jñānam ca dravyate
translated: Action and knowledge should be seen, and knowledge is said to be the object of knowledge.

analyzed: candra vat kriya vodhavyā sūrya vat jñānam ucyate
translated: Action should be known as like the moon, and knowledge is said to be like the sun.

original: ṛtukanyeva bodhavyā kriyāśakti varānane //🔽puṃ vadrāgānvitaṃ jñeyaṃ jñānaśakti na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: ṛtukanyā iva bodhavyā kriyāśakti varānane  pum vat rāga anvitam jñeyam jñānaśakti na saṃśayaḥ
translated: O beautiful one, the power of action should be known as the daughter of the season.🔽The power of knowledge should undoubtedly be known as endowed with passion like a male.

analyzed: pum kanyā yogavat jñeyam dṛkkriyā saṃniveśanam
translated: The union of vision and action should be known as like a male and a female.

original: atha kim bahunoktena dṛṣṭāntā kulitena tu /
analyzed: atha kim bahunā uktena dṛṣṭāntā kulitena tu
translated: Now, what is the use of speaking much or giving examples?

original: tvamahañca yathā pūrvaṃ saṃyogaṃ sthita hetukaṃ //
analyzed: tvam aham ca yathā pūrvam saṃyogam sthita hetukam
translated: Just as you and I existed earlier as the cause of union,

original: dṛkkriyā tu tathā yogo dharmiṇaḥ kriya hetukaṃ /
analyzed: dṛkkriyā tu tathā yogaḥ dharmiṇaḥ kriya hetukam
translated: so is the union of vision and action the cause of action for the possessor of attributes.

original: tvañca sākṣāt kriyārūpā piṇḍīrūpā ca yā sthitā //
analyzed: sākṣāt kriyā rūpā piṇḍī rūpā ca yā sthitā
translated: And you are actually in the form of action, existing in the form of the body,

analyzed: jñāna rūpa maha maha bhadre liṅga rūpeṇa yaḥ sthitaḥ
translated: and I, O good lady, am in the form of knowledge, existing in the form of the linga.

original: evaṃ saṃsthāpanaṃ proktaṃ prāsāde ca sureśvari //
analyzed: evam saṃsthāpanam proktam prāsāde ca sureśvari
translated: Thus, O Goddess of the gods, the installation is said to be in the temple.

original: praguṇe tu na cettasmin digjātaṃ kathitaṃ priye /🔽
analyzed: praguṇe tu na ced tasmin diś jātam kathitam priye  Ro
translated: If it is not straight, O beloved, the direction-born is said to be crooked.

analyzed: gatvā ācāryeṇa hotavyam sva kuṇḍe doṣa śāntaye
translated: The preceptor should go and offer oblations in his own fire pit for the sake of removing the fault.

original: aṣṭottaraśataṃ hutvā japaṃ kṛtvā tu bhāvitaḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭottaraśatam hutvā japam kṛtvā tu bhāvitaḥ
translated: Having offered one hundred and eight oblations and performed the japa with devotion,

original: tad digdevatāṃ hutvā tu cālayet praguṇānnayet //
analyzed: tat digdevatām hutvā tu cālayet praguṇān nayet
translated: having offered oblations to the deity of that direction, one should move it and bring it to the straight path.

analyzed: praguṇe tu su saṃjāte prāyacitantu homayet
translated: If it becomes very straight, one should offer oblations for atonement.

original: śataṃ śataṃ japaṃ kṛtvā tato nirdoṣatāṃ guruḥ //
analyzed: śatam śatam japam kṛtvā tatas nirdoṣa tām guruḥ
translated: Having repeated it a hundred times, the teacher becomes free from faults.

analyzed: tad kālena api tad kāle tad guroḥ dakṣiṇām dadet
translated: At that time, he should give dakshina to that teacher.

analyzed: tad vāhanāni tad mūlyam kṛtrimam vā atha hema jam
translated: His vehicles, their value, or artificial or golden,

analyzed: sampāta ādi abhi ghāta ādyaiḥ vakraiḥ diś bhrāntakaiḥ tathā
translated: By the fall of lightning and other blows, by crooked and confused directions,

original: anenaiva tu dānena datvā doṣairvimucyate //🔽svabhrasaṃdhintataḥ pūryavālukaḥ sūkṣmagālitaiḥ /
analyzed: anena eva tu dānena da tvā doṣaiḥ vimucyate  pūrya vālukaḥ sūkṣma gālitaiḥ
translated: By this very gift, having given, he is freed from faults.🔽Then the joint should be filled with fine melted sand.

analyzed: tāvat pūryaḥ tu tat sandhiḥ yā āvartta uttānakam priye
translated: The joint should be filled as much as the top of the mound, O beloved.

analyzed: kṣāra loha malaiḥ cūrṇaiḥ ālā cūrṇaiḥ su sūkṣmakaiḥ  śaṃkha cūrṇam su saṃgṛhya kṣauma taila vipācayet
translated: With alkaline metal dusts, and very fine conch shell powder,🔽Having collected the conch shell powder, it should be cooked with hemp oil.

original: yuktaṃ pākaṃ tataḥ kṛtvā visaṃdhintena kārayet /
analyzed: yuktam pākam tatas kṛtvā kārayet
translated: Having cooked it properly, the joint should be made with that.

analyzed: vicalet tena udaka ādi abhighātaḥ
translated: So that it does not move, by the blow of water and so on.

analyzed: tathā asau maṭhanam kuryāt anyathā doṣam āpnuyāt
translated: Thus he should make the temple, otherwise he would incur faults.

analyzed: udakam saṃdhi gaṃcha adhas pramādāt yat vijāyate
translated: If water accidentally enters the joint from below,

analyzed: siddhi hāni manaḥ udvega rogaḥ vā api atha pañcatā
translated: There is loss of success, mental anguish, illness, or even death.

original: tasmāt sarvaprayatnena jalaṃ praṇāligaṃ śubhaṃ //🔽praṇālādhaḥ praṇālañca śailajamvātha dārujaṃ /🔽sudṛḍhaṃ bhājanaṃ kṛtvā dātavyaṃ jalanirgamaṃ //
analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena jalam praṇāli gam śubham  praṇāla adhas praṇālam ca śailajam vā atha dārujam  su dṛḍham bhājanam kṛtvā dātavyam jala nirgamam
translated: Therefore, with all efforts, the auspicious water flowing through the channel should be used.🔽The channel should be made either of stone or wood, with a firm receptacle for the water to flow out.

original: prāsādānte vṛhat khātaṃ kūpavat paṭṭanirmitaṃ /🔽tato mūrti dharaiḥ sarvaiḥ prāgādyaiścānupūrvaśaḥ //
analyzed: prāsāda ante vṛhat khātam kūpa vat paṭṭa nirmitam  tatas mūrti dharaiḥ sarvaiḥ prāc ādyaiḥ ca anupūrvaśas
translated: At the end of the palace, a large pit should be made like a well, covered with a cloth.

analyzed: sva sva śānti ghaṭe na eva arddha arddhe na eva snāpayet
translated: Then, all the Murtidharas (priests) starting from the east should perform the ablution in their respective Santi vessels, half of which should be used for each priest.

original: svakaśānti ghaṭārddhena cumbakaḥ snānamācaret //🔽punaḥ paścād vibhāgena deśikaḥ snāpayecchivaṃ /🔽madhusnānaṃ purā kṛtvā jalasnānamataḥ paraṃ //🔽kṣīrasnānaṃ tato bhūya udakaṃ tadanaṃtaraṃ /
analyzed: punar paścāt vibhāgena deśikaḥ snāpayet śivam  madhu snānam purā kṛtvā jala snānam atas param  kṣīra snānam tatas bhūyas udakam tad anantaram
translated: The priest should perform the ablution of Shiva in the remaining half of his own Santi vessel.🔽After performing the honey ablution first, the water ablution should be done next.🔽Then milk ablution, followed by water ablution,

analyzed: dadhi snānam punar kṛtvā jala snānam vidhīyate
translated: then curd ablution again, followed by water ablution,

original: ghṛtasnānaṃ punarbhūya jalasnānamataḥ paraṃ /🔽madhusnānaṃ purākṛtvā jalasnānaṃ manantaraṃ //
analyzed: ghṛta snānam punar bhūya jala snānam atas param  madhu snānam purā kṛtvā jala snānam
translated: ghee ablution again, followed by water ablution,🔽honey ablution first, followed by water ablution,

analyzed: khaṇḍaiḥ snāpayet uṣṇa vāriṇā 🔽Ro
translated: then the ablution with sugar candy, followed by the ablution with hot water,

analyzed: rūkṣeṇa punar udvartya gaḍḍukān dāpayet vahūn
translated: After rubbing with a rough substance again, many balls should be applied.

analyzed: sāmānya vidhiḥ eva uktam pañcagavya ādi majjanam
translated: The general procedure is said to be the bathing with the five things got from a cow etc.

original: viśeṣaṃ cetadā bhadre snānaṃ pañcāmṛtaṃ purā /
analyzed: viśeṣam ca itadā bhadre snānam pañcāmṛtam purā
translated: And this special bathing, O good lady, is the bathing with the five sweet things first.

original: kṣatajena punaḥ snānaḥ snānaṃ gaṃdhatoyamataḥ paraṃ //🔽jalāntarāntara snānaṃ hṛnmantreṇa ca suvrate /
analyzed: kṣatajena punar snānaḥ snānam gaṃdha toyam atas param  snānam hṛd mantreṇa ca suvrate
translated: Then the bathing with blood, and after that the bathing with fragrant water.🔽The bathing in between the waters, O good lady of good vows, is with the heart mantra.

original: snānaṃ kṛtvā nyaset mantrān yathātmani samīhitān //
analyzed: snānam kṛtvā nyaset mantrān yathā ātmani samīhitān
translated: Having bathed, one should place the mantras as desired in the self.

analyzed: ananta ādi antu śakti antam sāmānye ca āsane nyaset
translated: One should place the general mantras from Ananta to Shakti on the seat.

analyzed: viśeṣam vā atha preta antam sva śāstra praviveditam
translated: Or the special ones up to Preta, as known from one's own scriptures.

analyzed: mūrti vaktra aṅga saṃyuktam mūlamantram nyaset priye
translated: O beloved, one should place the root mantra along with the forms, faces and limbs.

original: jñānaśaktiṃ nyaset prājñā vṛttabhāge tu mūrtivat //
analyzed: jñānaśaktim nyaset prājñā vṛtta bhāge tu mūrti vat
translated: The wise one should place the power of knowledge in the part of the forms.

original: tatparatvena mūlaṃ tu mantraṃ caiva sureśvari /
analyzed: tad para tvena mūlam tu mantram ca eva sureśvari
translated: O Goddess of gods, the root mantra along with that is the mantra.

original: kriyāśaktiṃ nyaset pīṭhe pretarūpaṃ ca socyate //
analyzed: kriyāśaktim nyaset pīṭhe preta rūpam ca sā ucyate
translated: One should place the power of action on the pedestal, and that is said to be in the form of Preta.

analyzed: mantra grāmam tu vinyasya dadet ca eva aṣṭapuṣpikām
translated: Having placed the group of mantras and the village, one should offer the eight-petaled flower.

analyzed: tatas hetu artham snānam vividham ācaret
translated: Then, for the sake of the purpose of worship, one should perform various kinds of bathing.

analyzed: tatas candana gandha ādyaiḥ kuṃkumaiḥ ca vilepayet
translated: Then it should be anointed with sandalwood paste, incense and saffron.

analyzed: pūjām kṛtvā su śobhā āḍhyām citra vastreṇa bhūṣayet
translated: Having worshipped with beautiful offerings, it should be adorned with colorful cloth.

analyzed: hema alaṅkārakaiḥ bhūṣyam guggula ādyaiḥ ca dhūpayet
translated: It should be adorned with golden ornaments and fumigated with guggula and other incense.

original: dīpaiḥ śobhāmataḥ kṛtvā naivedyaṃ vividhaṃ dadet //
analyzed: dīpaiḥ śobhām atas kṛtvā naivedyam vividham dadet
translated: Having illuminated it with lamps, various offerings should be made.

original: bhakṣyaṃ vividhabhojyaṃ vā lehyamvā coṣyameva vā /🔽peyaṃ vāthapradātavyaṃ sāmānyamvātha sundari //
analyzed: bhakṣyam vividha bhojyam vā lehyam vā coṣyam eva vā  peyam sāmānyam vā atha sundari
translated: Various edibles, food, lickable or chewable things,🔽or drinkable things should be offered, O beautiful one, or the general ones.

original: viśeṣaṃ vātha dātavyaṃ naivedyaṃ vividhaṃ priye /
analyzed: viśeṣam vā atha dātavyam naivedyam vividham priye
translated: Or, O beloved, various offerings should be made, especially.

original: aṣṭādaśavidhaiḥ mīnairmāṃsaiścaiva dviraṣṭabhiḥ //🔽phalajaiḥ puṣpajairmadyai guḍajaiḥ puṣpajairdadet /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśavidhaiḥ mīnaiḥ māṃsaiḥ ca eva dvis aṣṭabhiḥ  phala jaiḥ puṣpa jaiḥ madyaiḥ guḍa jaiḥ puṣpa jaiḥ dadet
translated: With eighteen kinds of fish and sixteen kinds of meat,🔽with fruit-based, flower-based, wine-based, and molasses-based drinks, one should offer.

analyzed: gīta nṛtya utsavaiḥ devi ghaṃṭā ḍamaru nāditaiḥ
translated: With singing, dancing, and festivals, O Goddess, resounding with bells and cymbals,

analyzed: divārātra utsavaiḥ divyaiḥ bhūyet vina catuṣṭayam
translated: with divine day and night festivals, the fourfold (worship) should be increased.

original: puṣpadhūpādi naivedya tāmbūlādi pradāpanataḥ //🔽sāmānye vācamennityaṃ hastapādādi kṣālanaṃ /
analyzed: puṣpa dhūpa ādi naivedya tāmbūla ādi pradāpanataḥ  sāmānye vā ācamet nityam hasta pāda ādi kṣālanam
translated: By offering flowers, incense, and other offerings, betel nut and other things,🔽in the general (worship), one should always sip water and wash the hands, feet, and so on.

analyzed: viśeṣena ācamet maṃtrī
translated: The reciter should sip water and bow to the feet, etc., in the special (worship).

analyzed: yatas dvi artham ca samānyam dvaita advaita viduḥ vudhāḥ
translated: The wise know that duality and non-duality are for the sake of the two purposes.

analyzed: viśeṣa eka artha saṃjñā iyam kevalā dvaita lakṣaṇam  Ro
translated: This is the mere characteristic of duality, known as the single purpose of the particulars.

analyzed: rātraḥ jāgara dānam ca geya nṛtyaḥ tu vāditaiḥ
translated: Keeping awake at night, giving gifts, singing, dancing and playing musical instruments,

analyzed: mahā utsavaiḥ dināni eva sāmānye vā atha kārayet
translated: One should perform the great festival for the days, either in the general or special way.

analyzed: divā nivārita satram dīna anāthon ca dāpayet
translated: During the day, an unrestricted sacrifice should be performed, and the poor and helpless should be given gifts.

original: viśeṣaṃ cettadā vīrairyoginīkārakaiḥ saha //🔽vīrabhojyānnapānādyaṃ divānte niśi vā caret /
analyzed: viśeṣam ced tadā vīraiḥ yoginī kārakaiḥ saha  vīra bhojya anna pāna ādyam divā ante niśi vā caret
translated: If it is special, then along with the heroes and the makers of Yoginis,🔽The food, drink, etc. to be eaten by the heroes should be performed at the end of the day or at night.

analyzed: nṛtya geya sava ādyaiḥ ca dināni evam mahā utsavam
translated: With dancing, singing and musical instruments, the great festival should be like this for the days.

original: cumbako mūrtipaiḥ sārddha trikālaṃ homayed divā /
analyzed: cumbakaḥ mūrtipaiḥ sārddha tri kālam homayet divā
translated: The Chumbaka, along with the Murtipas, should perform the homa three times a day.

analyzed: sadā vā dravya bhāvāt ca homa sārddhatrikaḥ vidhiḥ
translated: Or always, due to the availability of the substance, the homa should be performed along with the three-fold procedure.

analyzed: cukaḥ su samāhitaḥ
translated: When the fourth night arrives, the Chuka should be well-concentrated.

analyzed: caturthī homayet prājñāḥ jñātvā dravya valāvalam
translated: The wise one should perform the fourth homa, knowing the strength and sequence of the substances.

original: śataṃ vātha sahasramvā mūrtipaiḥ saha saṃyutaḥ /
analyzed: śatam vā atha sahasram vā mūrtipaiḥ saha saṃyutaḥ
translated: Either a hundred or a thousand, along with the Murtipas.

analyzed: naivedya bhakṣya bhojyāni lehya coṣyāṇi yāni tu
translated: The food offerings, edible and consumable items, lickable and suckable items,

analyzed: sarvāyanayanam kṛtvā pūjāyanayanam tathā
translated: Having collected all the offerings and the offerings for worship,

analyzed: kumāryāḥ bhrātṛ putrāṇām
translated: For unmarried girls, brothers, sons, and those without protectors or relatives,

analyzed: naivedyam ca pradātavyam bhakṣaṇa ayana saṃśayaḥ
translated: Food offerings should be given without doubt for consumption.

analyzed: divya puṣpa pradātavyam dhāraṇāya vipaścitā
translated: Divine flowers should be given for wearing by the wise.

analyzed: na nirmālyam vinirdiṣṭa yatas caṇḍa aiśvaram vinā
translated: They are not considered leftover flowers, except for the Canda Ishvara.

analyzed: atas nirdoṣam eva uktam bhakṣaṇe dhāraṇe api vā
translated: Therefore, it is said to be faultless to consume or wear,

original: dāne vā grahaṇe cāpi sāmānyavātha suvrate /
analyzed: dāne vā grahaṇe ca api sāmānyavān atha suvrate
translated: To give or receive, in general, O one of good vows.

analyzed: viśeṣa sannidhaḥ yasmāt tasmāt yutatara a stute
translated: Since there is a special presence, therefore, you are even more united.

analyzed: siddhi mukti kara aṇubhyaḥ caruke ca yathā matā
translated: As is accepted in the oblation that grants spiritual accomplishments and liberation,

original: tataḥ sanmājaṃ kṛtvā snāpya devaṃ yathocitaṃ //
analyzed: tatas sat mājam kṛtvā snāpya devam yathocitam
translated: Having thus performed the assembly, having bathed the deity as appropriate,

analyzed: vividhaiḥ pūrva nirdiṣṭaiḥ gandha toya ādibhiḥ priye
translated: With various fragrances, waters, and so on, as previously indicated, O beloved,

analyzed: yathā ucita ātmabhiḥ dravyaiḥ pūjayet su samāhitaḥ
translated: One should worship with collected mind, with substances suitable for oneself.

analyzed: gandha puṣpa ādikam gṛhya diś valim ca samāharet
translated: Having taken fragrances, flowers, and so on, one should collect the offerings to the directions.

analyzed: ācamya āgatya bhūyas tu dakṣiṇāmūrti saṃsthitaḥ
translated: Having sipped water and returned, abiding in the form of Dakshinamurti,

original: sāmānye caiva liṅge tu vidviśeṣaṃ visarjayet /
analyzed: sāmānye ca eva liṅge tu vid viśeṣam visarjayet
translated: In the case of a general linga, one should dismiss the specific.

analyzed: sva yāgaḥ ca eva yoni astaḥ tad ātma stham ca kārayet
translated: One's own sacrifice and the other sacrifices should be performed within oneself.

original: liṅge mūrtau nyaseccaṇḍaṃ caṇḍakrodheti viśrutaḥ /🔽tadutthamiti taṃ dhyātvā jñānamūrtyātmagātu yā //
analyzed: liṅge mūrtau nyaset caṇḍam caṇḍakrodha iti viśrutaḥ  tat uttham iti tam dhyātvā jñāna mūrti ātma gātu yā
translated: One should install Caṇḍa in the Liṅga, well-known as Caṇḍakrodha.

analyzed: Ro jvālā jaṭāla duḥprekṣe daṃṣṭrālaḥ vikṛta ānanaḥ
translated: Having meditated on him as arising from that, one should go to the abode of the Jñānamūrti (embodiment of knowledge).🔽Having a face with distorted teeth, difficult to look at due to the matted locks of flame,

analyzed: śarad kunda indu dhavalam krodha caṇḍaḥ viniḥsṛtaḥ
translated: Krodhacaṇḍa has emerged, white like the autumn jasmine and the moon.

analyzed: svayam eva maheśaḥ tu amūrtau mūrtim āgataḥ
translated: Maheśa himself, in an embodied form, has come from the formless.

analyzed: vicintya caṇḍarudram tu krodhan devāt vinirgataḥ
translated: Having contemplated on Caṇḍa Rudra, Krodha has emerged from the god.

analyzed: ca tad māne liṅgāt īśe niveśayet
translated: One should install it in the Liṅga of Īśa, in one's own heart.

analyzed: sa puṣpeṇa eva deveśa mudrā saṃhārakena tu
translated: O Lord of gods, having installed it with a flower and the mudrā Saṃhāra,

analyzed: niveśya evam punar bhūyas pīṭhāt īśe ca kalpayet
translated: having installed it again, one should conceive it in the Īśa of the pedestal.

original: anantākhyā tu yā śaktiḥ sā calācalarūpiṇī //🔽pātrarūpā ca draṣṭavyā caṇḍasyāsanarūpiṇī /
analyzed: ananta ākhyā tu yā śaktiḥ sā cala acala rūpiṇī  pātra rūpā ca draṣṭavyā caṇḍasya āsana rūpiṇī
translated: That Śakti known as Anantā has a form that is both moving and unmoving.🔽She should be seen in the form of a vessel, in the form of the seat of Caṇḍa.

analyzed: prakalpya ādau caṇḍamūrtin niveśayet  sa visarga kathā ākhyena om namaḥ ca ādiḥ antataḥ
translated: Having first conceived that seat, one should install the form of Caṇḍa.🔽With the sound of emission at the beginning and end, one should utter Om Namaḥ.

analyzed: kevalam vāsanam bhavet
translated: It is said to be embodied, but it should be mere desire.

analyzed: tad eva svara dīrghaiḥ tu ṣaṣ aṅgāni prakalpayet
translated: One should conceive the six limbs with that itself, long and with svarita (intonation).

analyzed: svaraiḥ hrasvaiḥ prayuktantu pañcavaktrañca kalpayet
translated: If short vowels are used, one should imagine it to have five faces.

analyzed: kṣaum iti mūlamaṃtraḥ tu svayam caṇḍeśvaram param
translated: The root mantra is kṣauṃ, and the supreme Caṇḍeśvara is oneself.

analyzed: tat sthāne kṛṣṇa rūpam tu catur kara su bhāsuram
translated: In its place, one should meditate on the dark-hued form, with four hands and beautiful radiance,

analyzed: dhyātavyam devadeveśe pūrvam vai śiva nirmitam
translated: previously created by Śiva, O Lord of the Lord of gods.

analyzed: gandha puṣpa ādibhiḥ pūjya tad dharma astreṇa rodhayet
translated: Having worshipped with scents, flowers, etc., one should restrain it with the weapon of its own Dharma.

analyzed: homam kṛtvā tatas paścāt caṇḍeśvara vikalpanā
translated: Having performed the homa, one should then imagine Caṇḍeśvara.

original: taddiśāvalokayedbhūyaḥ prākārasyāntasannidhau //🔽āgāraṃ kalpayet tatra aiṣṭaṃ vāpyatha śailajaṃ /
